doc.abstracts: On September 12, 1991 Montague Yudelman was interviewed by the Brookings Institution on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by John Lewis and Devesh Kapur. During his tenure at the Bank from 1972 to 1984, Mr. Yudelman worked in the following areas: for the agricultural mission to Colombia as an agricultural economist; as senior adviser in agriculture projects department (1972-1973); and as director in agriculture department (1973-1984). His transcript concerns the agriculture sector, rural development, and rural poverty under the presidencies of Robert McNamara and A. W. Clausen.
